title: VIP: Add built-in getter for index of array elements
body:
## Simple Summary
This VIP adds the ability to find the index of an element in a static array.

## Motivation
Currently, if one wants to know the location of an element in a static array, they'd have to do the following:

```vyper
ARRAY_LENGTH: int128 = 10
array: uint256[ARRAY_LENGTH] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 0]
for i in range(ARRAY_LENGTH):
    if array[i] == 5:
        location: int128 = i
        break
```

This can be cumbersome for users who want to know the location of an array element. A practical example is derived from Curve registry contracts:

```vyper
@view
@internal
def _get_coin_indices(
    _pool: address,
    _from: address,
    _to: address
) -> uint256[3]:
    """
    Convert coin addresses to indices for use with pool methods
    """
    result: uint256[3] = empty(uint256[3])
    _coins: address[MAX_COINS] = self._get_coins(_pool)
    found_market: bool = False

    # check coin markets
    for x in range(MAX_COINS):
        coin: address = _coins[x]
        if coin == ZERO_ADDRESS:
            # if we reach the end of the coins, reset `found_market` and try again
            # with the underlying coins
            found_market = False
            break
        if coin == _from:
            result[0] = convert(x, uint256)
        elif coin == _to:
            result[1] = convert(x, uint256)
        else:
            continue

        if found_market:
            # the second time we find a match, break out of the loop
            break
        # the first time we find a match, set `found_market` to True
        found_market = True

    return result
```

## Specification
Proposed interface:

```vyper
ARRAY_LENGTH: int128 = 10
array: uint256[ARRAY_LENGTH] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 0]
location: int128 = array.index(5)
```

If the array does not contain the queried element, revert.

## Backwards Compatibility
No backwards incompatibility is foreseen.

## Dependencies
Does not depend on any other VIPs.

## References
No references, other than the curve contract where the current method of using for loops is used: https://github.com/curvefi/curve-pool-registry/blob/16a8664952cf61d7fed06acca79ad5ac696f4b20/contracts/CryptoRegistry.vy#L286
